desc.title: The classic C Major
desc.body: This is the most common, and basic, chord, the root triad in the C major scale.

desc.title: C minor
desc.body: This is often the introduction to the minor chord. Listen to its melancholy sound that feels unresolved.

desc.title: F major
desc.body: This is the F major chord that everyone uses, but it's actually the 1st inversion, as you can see in the Chromatic diagram.

desc.title: D 7 suspended
desc.body: Probably the most universal of the 7th chords, the D7 has two characteristics: It's missing its perfect 5th, giving it the 'suspended' term, and it has a augmented 7th.
